{"id":502603807,"lang":"java","time":"1 month, 3 weeks","timestamp":1622752917,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"2 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/502603807/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"40.2 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public double findMedianSortedArrays(int[] nums1, int[] nums2) {\n        int[] nums=new int[nums1.length+nums2.length];\n        \n        int i=0;\n        int j=0;\n        int k=0;\n        while(i<nums1.length && j<nums2.length)\n        {\n            if(nums1[i]<=nums2[j])\n            {\n                nums[k++]=nums1[i];\n                i++;\n            }else\n            {\n                nums[k++]=nums2[j];\n                j++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if(i==nums1.length && j==nums2.length)\n        {\n            //Do nothing\n        }\n        else if(i==nums1.length)\n        {\n            for(int p=j;p<nums2.length;p++)\n                nums[k++]=nums2[p];\n        }else{\n            for(int p=i;p<nums1.length;p++)\n                nums[k++]=nums1[p];\n        }\n        \n        int l=nums1.length+nums2.length;\n        \n        if(l%2==0)\n        {\n            return (double)(((double)nums[l/2]+(double)nums[(l/2)-1])/2);\n        }\n        \n        \n        return (double)nums[(nums1.length+nums2.length)/2];\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays"}
